@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:39, topic:330825”][quote author=Koolvin link=topic=427199.msg3170652#msg3170652 date=1270416439]
Make it pop up a form that makes you specify old pass, then new pass, then confirm.
[/quote]

I think he was talking about making it pop up a new UI instead of just an interface within the client.

item.title: Confirmation window for changing your password (with limit up to 20 characters)
item.dc:creator: @Excorsist Excorsist
item.description:
@Excorsist wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:30, topic:330825”][quote author=Excorsist link=topic=427199.msg3140027#msg3140027 date=1267405577]
Looks bloody awesome.

But i type in ::changepass (password) and it comes up with the “are you sure you want to change your password to (password)?”

I click the “click here to continue” and the dialogue box goes back to the chatbox and nothing else comes up.

I’ve followed your guide exactly right…i think x]. i’ve gone through it all 3 times and cant pick a mistake i’ve made.

Any Suggestions :)?
[/quote]

Make sure NpcDialogue = 499; is inside of your ::changepass command and make sure if (NpcDialogue == 499) { NpcDialogue = 500; choice("Yes", "No"); } is inside the correct case 40 and isn’t interfering with any of the other code inside of it.[/quote]

Yes that is all right.

I just copied and pasted everything out of the tutorial.
Its defiantly the right case 40, has a whole heap of npc dialogue. There is another case 40 but im certain thats the wrong one ;).

when i search NpcDialogue = 500; the only one that comes up is the one in that code, same with NpcDialogue == 499 So im certain it isn’t interfering with anything else.

Read full topic

item.title: Confirmation window for changing your password (with limit up to 20 characters)
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“Excorsist, post:29, topic:330825”]Looks bloody awesome.

But i type in ::changepass (password) and it comes up with the “are you sure you want to change your password to (password)?”

I click the “click here to continue” and the dialogue box goes back to the chatbox and nothing else comes up.

I’ve followed your guide exactly right…i think x]. i’ve gone through it all 3 times and cant pick a mistake i’ve made.

Any Suggestions :)?[/quote]

Make sure NpcDialogue = 499; is inside of your ::changepass command and make sure if (NpcDialogue == 499) { NpcDialogue = 500; choice("Yes", "No"); } is inside the correct case 40 and isn’t interfering with any of the other code inside of it.

Read full topic

item.source: Confirmation window for changing your password (with limit up to 20 characters)

item.title: Confirmation window for changing your password (with limit up to 20 characters)
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

That’s what all of the password changing commands do, but for some odd reason, it still remains a way to scam someone. Adding this into your server makes it a more professional password changer and more stable in my opinion. It’s not just a simple ::pass [newpass] then it sends you one message in you chat box that you may not catch. This way ensures that the user in fact wants to change their password because they must click through a series of windows in order to do that.

Also, the reason I decided to limit the command to only allow 20 characters is because that’s the limit it goes up to when you’re typing in your password on the login screen. It prevents those problems too. I don’t know why people are so against this tutorial. >.>

Read full topic
item.source: Confirmation window for changing your password (with limit up to 20 characters)

item.title: Confirmation window for changing your password (with limit up to 20 characters)
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

by making the command using command.startswith, you make it so if the command starts with “pass” and still has anything after it it will still count, but command.equalsIgnoreCase just couts it if it has just pass in it

edit: lol nvm that was an idiotic suggestion…

what would really work though, is making it tell you that you changed your pass when you do ::pass

Read full topic

instead of

but yeah this looks way cooler too :P[/quote]
